decision.summary: The extracted knowledge graph contains critical schema violations (missing required fields: node_rationale, edge_confidence_rationale, edge_rationale) and logical errors (4 reversed-direction edges with incorrect 'validated_by' type that contradict and duplicate the correct 'motivates' edges). Additionally, 6 important nodes from the source are missing: the inadequate equilibria theoretical insight (central to 'My Take' section), media sector size limitation evidence, RealPlayer technology-adoption-without-growth validation, real estate cartel case, housing systemic drag concept, and the discontinuous-takeoff theoretical conclusion. All nodes lack required rationale fields. After proposed fixes are applied (adding 6 nodes, removing 4 duplicate edges, adding all required fields), the knowledge fabric will properly connect the source's causal reasoning from empirical risk through policy bottleneck analysis to sector-specific interventions, with complete traceability to source sections.

schema_check.issue: Missing required fields in edges: edge_confidence_rationale and edge_rationale are specified in final_output_format but absent from all edges
schema_check.suggestion: Add edge_confidence_rationale and edge_rationale fields to all 22 edges with evidence from DATA_SOURCE sections

schema_check.issue: Missing required fields in nodes: node_rationale is specified in final_output_format but absent from all nodes
schema_check.suggestion: Add node_rationale field to all 17 nodes with justification and closest preceding section title

schema_check.issue: intervention_lifecycle_rationale and intervention_maturity_rationale missing from intervention nodes
schema_check.suggestion: Add detailed rationale fields for all 5 intervention nodes with section references

schema_check.issue: embedding field present in schema but empty/null throughout; not in required format specification
schema_check.suggestion: Remove embedding field or populate if applicable per downstream requirements

referential_check.issue: Edge uses non-existent target node: validated_by edges reference 'Stagnation of total factor productivity 2005-2023 despite digital technology adoption' as TARGET when it should be SOURCE
names: Zoning deregulation policies to increase housing supply
Fast-track permitting for energy infrastructure projects
Transportation regulation revision to reduce project costs
Stagnation of total factor productivity 2005-2023 despite digital technology adoption

referential_check.issue: Incorrect edge directionality: 4 edges labeled 'validated_by' have reversed logic - validation evidence should flow FROM validation node TO concept nodes, not FROM mechanisms TO evidence

rationale_mismatches.issue: Edge type 'validated_by' is used incorrectly: implementation mechanisms are not validated by TFP evidence; rather, evidence MOTIVATES interventions
rationale_mismatches.evidence: SOURCE: 'My Take' section states 'Eli's piece...persuaded me to be more sceptical...' - persuasion/motivation flows FROM evidence TO interventions, not the reverse
rationale_mismatches.fix: Change 4 'validated_by' edges (Zoning→Stagnation, Fast-track→Stagnation, Transportation→Stagnation, Adaptive→Stagnation) to have reversed source/target and change type to 'motivated_by' or remove entirely as they duplicate the 4 'motivates' edges

rationale_mismatches.issue: Missing critical theoretical insight node about inadequate equilibria that is central to the author's 'My Take' section
rationale_mismatches.evidence: SOURCE 'My Take': 'insomuch as you believe that inadequate equilibria abound in our civilisation, then apriori you should not expect AI to precipitate massive economic transformation near term'
rationale_mismatches.fix: Add node: 'Prevalence of inadequate equilibria in civilization constraining AI economic impact' as theoretical insight

rationale_mismatches.issue: Missing key insight about media market size limitation on AI productivity impact
rationale_mismatches.evidence: SOURCE 'Eli's Thesis': 'the effect on aggregate productivity is limited by the size of the media market, which is perhaps 2 percent of global GDP'
rationale_mismatches.fix: Add node: 'Limited aggregate productivity impact from AI in media content generation despite quality improvements' and connect to risk

rationale_mismatches.issue: Missing critical validation evidence: the RealPlayer anecdote demonstrating prediction error
rationale_mismatches.evidence: SOURCE 'Eli's Thesis': 'I thought...This is never going to work...And yet, if I had only said there is no way that online video will meaningfully contribute to economic growth, I would have been right.'
rationale_mismatches.fix: Add validation evidence node about limitations of technology adoption for economic impact; this directly validates the thesis

rationale_mismatches.issue: Missing key problem analysis node about internet's failure to disrupt real estate agents
rationale_mismatches.evidence: SOURCE 'Eli's Thesis' (Housing section): 'he points out that the internet did not break up the real estate agent cartel (despite his initial expectations to the contrary)'
rationale_mismatches.fix: Add node: 'Internet failed to disrupt real estate intermediary monopolies despite technological capability' as problem analysis

nodes.name: Persisting economic stagnation despite advanced AI development
nodes.description: Total factor productivity has remained flat or declined since 2005 although digital technology and AI have advanced rapidly, indicating a risk that AI will not improve broad economic welfare.

nodes.name: Non-technical policy bottlenecks in major economic sectors
nodes.description: Across housing, energy, transportation and health, restrictive laws and regulations rather than inadequate technology are argued to be the main drag on productivity.

nodes.name: Land use restrictions limiting housing supply
nodes.description: Zoning laws and other land-use policies constrain housing construction, keeping prices high and dampening economic activity connected to housing.

nodes.name: Regulatory hurdles delaying energy infrastructure deployment
nodes.description: Lengthy permitting, environmental reviews and other regulatory processes slow the roll-out of new energy generation and transmission capacity.

nodes.name: Regulatory barriers inflating transportation project costs
nodes.description: Rules governing procurement, environmental review and labor raise the cost and delay the delivery of transportation infrastructure projects in the US.

nodes.name: Escalating clinical trial costs inhibiting health sector productivity
nodes.description: Per-patient clinical trial costs have risen from roughly $10k to $500k, largely due to regulatory and administrative factors, slowing drug development.

nodes.name: Technological innovation requires complementary policy reform to realize productivity gains
nodes.description: Theoretical observation that without removing socio-legal constraints, even exponential advances in AI will not convert into material output growth.

nodes.name: Targeted regulatory reform to unlock AI-driven sectoral productivity
nodes.description: Design principle that identifies sector-specific deregulation as the primary lever to translate AI and other technologies into economic growth.

nodes.name: Zoning deregulation policies to increase housing supply
nodes.description: Specific policy mechanism: eliminating or loosening zoning and land-use restrictions to permit denser or more varied housing construction.

nodes.name: Fast-track permitting for energy infrastructure projects
nodes.description: Administrative mechanism that caps review timelines and simplifies permitting to hasten deployment of generation and transmission assets.

nodes.name: Transportation regulation revision to reduce project costs
nodes.description: Mechanism covering procurement reform, standardized designs and relaxed labor mandates to lower unit costs of rail and road projects.

nodes.name: Adaptive clinical trial regulatory framework
nodes.description: Use of adaptive designs, data-driven monitoring and reduced bureaucratic overhead to cut clinical trial expenses while maintaining safety.

nodes.name: Stagnation of total factor productivity 2005-2023 despite digital technology adoption
nodes.description: Empirical observation: productivity statistics in the US and Europe show minimal growth since mid-2000s even as smartphones and the Internet proliferated.

nodes.name: Enact zoning deregulation to expand housing supply
nodes.description: Policy action: pass local or state legislation removing restrictive zoning limits and simplifying approval to allow greater housing density.

nodes.name: Implement fast-track energy project permitting processes
nodes.description: Legislate strict timelines, single-agency authority and standardized requirements to shorten permitting for generation and transmission projects.

nodes.name: Revise transportation regulations to lower infrastructure costs
nodes.description: Amend procurement, labor and environmental rules to match international best practices and cut per-mile costs of transport projects.

nodes.name: Adopt adaptive clinical trial approval pathways to reduce drug development costs
nodes.description: Regulatory agencies permit adaptive designs, shared control arms and real-world evidence to lower per-patient trial costs and speed approvals.

edges.source_node: Persisting economic stagnation despite advanced AI development
edges.target_node: Non-technical policy bottlenecks in major economic sectors
edges.description: Regulatory and legal constraints across key sectors are argued to be the main reason AI has not raised productivity.

edges.source_node: Non-technical policy bottlenecks in major economic sectors
edges.target_node: Land use restrictions limiting housing supply
edges.description: Housing sector bottleneck is a specific instance of broader policy constraints.

edges.source_node: Technological innovation requires complementary policy reform to realize productivity gains
edges.target_node: Targeted regulatory reform to unlock AI-driven sectoral productivity
edges.description: Design principle proposes policy reform as solution to the insight.

edges.source_node: Stagnation of total factor productivity 2005-2023 despite digital technology adoption
edges.target_node: Enact zoning deregulation to expand housing supply

notes: BLOCKER: Missing node_rationale on all 17 nodes. Final_output_format specifies 'node_rationale: why essential to fabric with closest preceding data source section title reference' as required.
BLOCKER: Missing edge_confidence_rationale and edge_rationale on all 22 edges. Final_output_format requires both fields.

BLOCKER: Four edges incorrectly labeled 'validated_by' with implementation mechanism nodes as source and evidence node as target (reversed). Validation evidence cannot validate implementation mechanisms - evidence validates concepts. These 4 edges contradict 4 identical 'motivates' edges in correct direction (Stagnation→Intervention).

MAJOR: Six conceptual nodes missing from knowledge fabric that are explicitly stated in DATA_SOURCE: (1) Inadequate equilibria as constraint - 'My Take' section: 'insomuch as you believe that inadequate equilibria abound in our civilisation, then apriori you should not expect AI to precipitate massive economic transformation near term'; (2) Media market size limitation - 'Eli's Thesis': 'effect on aggregate productivity is limited by the size of the media market, which is perhaps 2 percent of global GDP'; (3) RealPlayer validation evidence - 'Eli's Thesis' anecdote concluding 'if I had only said there is no way that online video will meaningfully contribute to economic growth, I would have been right'; (4) Real estate cartel persistence - 'Eli's Thesis' Housing: 'the internet did not break up the real estate agent cartel'; (5) Housing systemic multiplier - 'Eli's Thesis' Housing: 'Housing factors through virtually all sectors of the economy'; (6) Discontinuous takeoff conclusion - 'My Take': 'persuaded me to be more sceptical of Paul style continuous takeoff and more open to discontinuous takeoff'.
MAJOR: Intervention nodes [12-16] missing intervention_lifecycle_rationale and intervention_maturity_rationale fields required by schema for type=intervention nodes.
MINOR: embedding field present throughout but not specified in final_output_format requirements; recommend removal for clarity.

Coverage gap: Edge showing how AI optimization opportunities exist but are bottlenecked by regulation (from 'Eli's Thesis' Energy section) is mentioned in problem analysis nodes but lacks explicit implementation edge showing this relationship.
Traceability verification: All remaining nodes after fixes should cite specific section titles per instructions. Current nodes either lack rationale entirely or have minimal section attribution.
